Walden Mathews wrote:
> 1. You train your user to use the system at full leverage.
 
Can you clarify what you mean by "full leverage."
 
> 2. You retain encapsulation of your implementation, 
> and are then free to change it without breaking your 
> clients.
 
Giving users the ability to manually hack or guess URLs does not constrain
you from changing in the future (although, "Cool URIs don't change"...)
Users who hack or guess URLs in a manual mode do so almost exclusively right
after retrieving an existing resource.  And if a URL changes that they used
to go to, they are human, they will adjust.
